edu.byu.rpg.screens

Class ScreenBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.byu.rpg.screens.ScreenBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlayScreen

    public abstract class ScreenBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    The base class for all of our screens.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.OrthographicCamera camera
      The 2D camera.
      protected RpgGame game
      Local instance of game (for access to the game's RpgGame.assets, RpgGame.batch, RpgGame.engine)
      protected com.badlogic.gdx.utils.viewport.FitViewport viewport
      The 320x240 viewport

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScreenBase(RpgGame game)
      This object's constructor re-initializes the RpgGame.engine, which clears all entities any time we switch screens.

    • Field Detail

      • game

        protected RpgGame game
        Local instance of game (for access to the game's RpgGame.assets, RpgGame.batch, RpgGame.engine)

      • camera

        protected com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.OrthographicCamera camera
        The 2D camera.

      • viewport

        protected com.badlogic.gdx.utils.viewport.FitViewport viewport
        The 320x240 viewport

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenBase

        public ScreenBase(RpgGame game)
        This object's constructor re-initializes the RpgGame.engine, which clears all entities any time we switch screens. You should load any entities to the game's engine after calling this constructor. This function also initializes camera and viewport.
        Parameters:
        game - Our main game class.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        This is where all of our core game engine logic and drawing should happen. By default, it simply clears the screen to black and sorts drawSystem's elements.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        delta - Time since last frame.

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        This function is automatically called whenever the screen is resized. It resets the viewport to fill the game window.
        Specified by:
        resize in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the game window.
        height - The new height of the game window.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This is where you should dispose of any objects created for a screen that need to be manually disposed of. Basically, if your screen is using any LibGDX object has a dispose method, you should override this method and then call that object's dispose method here.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • show

        public void show()
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

        public void pause()
        Specified by:
        pause in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Specified by:
        resume in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
